bibl.note: This is a letter to Adam Fergusson dated July 24, 1849. The author's name is not clear. The author is requesting that Fergusson settle a debt with him so that he will have more money for an upcoming move.

div1.p: Excuse me for troubling you with this note but as I wish to start East about the first of August will want all the funds that I can possibly get you will therefore doe us the favour to remit the amount of your account
Times have been so hard here this summer that we find ourselves almost unable to make our arrangements for the fall trade
we hope you will find it convenient to comply with our request and that we will receive a centimment of you favour
